Bioenergy.Description: Bioenergy is produced by converting biomass into usable energy through various processes such as combustion or anaerobic digestion.
Bioenergy is commonly used as a biofuel, which is a type of alternative fuel derived from renewable biological sources.
Biogas, which is produced through the anaerobic digestion of organic matter, can be further processed to generate bioenergy.
Bioenergy is utilized in the production of bioethanol, a renewable fuel commonly used as a gasoline additive or standalone fuel.
